snippet: Mr. Lundvall, who led Blue Note for 25 years, added some of the greatest jazz musicians of the age to the label while expanding its success into other genres with artists like Willie Nelson, Al Green and Norah Jones.
abstract: Bruce Lundvall, whose long tenure at the helm of Blue Note and other labels made him one of the most influential behind-the-scenes figures in recent jazz history, dies at age 79.
lead_paragraph: Mr. Lundvall, who led Blue Note for 25 years, added some of the greatest jazz musicians of the age to the label while expanding its success into other genres with artists like Willie Nelson, Al Green and Norah Jones.

headline.main: Bruce Lundvall, Who Revived Blue Note Jazz Label, Dies at 79
headline.print_headline: Bruce Lundvall, 79; Revived Blue Note Label
